oracle.mapviewer.share.style
Class TextStyleModel

java.lang.Object
  oracle.mapviewer.share.style.AbstractStyleModel
      oracle.mapviewer.share.style.TextStyleModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, StyleModel
public class TextStyleModel
extends AbstractStyleModel

Represents the data model for a MapViewer TEXT style.

setLetterSpacing

public void setLetterSpacing(float letterSpacing)
Sets the additional spacing required between letters or characters. The value represents percentage of the current font size used by this style. For instance a value of 200 means 200% of the font size will be added to the normal spacing between letters.

Parameters:
letterSpacing - - percentage points of the font size

getLetterSpacing

public float getLetterSpacing()
Returns the current additional letter spacing.

Returns:
float - additional letter spacing 9percentage points of the font size)

setSmartPathFollowing

public void setSmartPathFollowing(boolean smartPathFollowing)
Sets the smart path following option to true or false. When set to true, and if the labeling hint LabelingHints.KEY_LINE_VALIGN is set to VALUE_LINE_VALIGN_BOTTOM, MapViewer will ensure that the text is always labeled on the left side of the path linestring. This is useful when you need to label text around polygon boundaries and want to ensure these labels always stay inside the polygon.

Parameters:
smartPathFollowing - - set to true if you want to turn the smart path following option to on; you must also set the labeling hint LabelingHints.KEY_LINE_VALIGN to VALUE_LINE_VALIGN_BOTTOM for this effect to occur.

isSmartPathFollowing

public boolean isSmartPathFollowing()
Returns the current option setting on smart path following.

Returns:
boolean - current setting of the smart path following option.

getTextDecoration

public java.lang.String getTextDecoration()
Returns the text decoration, which is a line drawn with the text. Possible values: NONE, UNDERLINE, LINETHROUGH, OVERLINE

Returns:
String - tex decoration

setTextDecoration

public void setTextDecoration(java.lang.String decoration)
Sets the text decoration, which is a line drawn with the text. Possible values: NONE, UNDERLINE, LINETHROUGH, OVERLINE

Parameters:
decoration - - text decoration

setMultilineSpacing

public void setMultilineSpacing(float spacing)
Sets the space between lines (in points).

Parameters:
spacing - a value in points.

setStraightLineLabeling

public void setStraightLineLabeling(boolean param)
Sets the flag to enable or disable straight-line labeling. When labeling a linear feature, if this flag is set to true then the text will always be labeled along a straight line instead of following the linear feature closely. The straight line may be angled to approximate the orientation of the linear feature. This flag has no effect when labeling point or polygong features.

Parameters:
param - - true to enable straight-line labeling or false to disable

isStraightLineLabeling

public boolean isStraightLineLabeling()
Returns the value of the flag that controls straight-line labeling on linear features.

Returns:
boolean - current value of the straight line labeling flag
